page.title: 05INDUSTRY
page.content: This small factory on the main street in Dalbeattie makes fashion and leisure garments for mail order catalogues in the U.K.The material is bought both in U.K.and abroad.The design is either customer specified or the factories own.The material is laid out in layers of 25 and the shape of each piece stamped on it is then cut using an electric cutting machine.The next step is to mark each piece with a number so that the machinists know which pieces to join.Here this is known as soabar.The machinists sit in rows each sewing their particular part of each garment which is finished with buttons or studs at the end of the line.Each garment then has to be passed and sent to pressers or back to be corrected.Some garments are washed before pressing as this is fashionable at present.A laundry is on sight.
